EVJ.A: The global maximum heat value is {0.93}.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Nuclear and Policy or the cell corresponding to Renewables and Storage?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Nuclear} and {Policy} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Distribution and Production or the cell corresponding to Distribution and Storage?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Distribution} and {Production} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Renewables and Investment or the cell corresponding to Exploration and Technology?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Renewables} and {Investment} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.24 to 0.45?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Coal, Storage), (Distribution, Storage), (Electricity, Storage), (Exploration, Storage), (Gas, Storage), (Nuclear, Storage), (Renewables, Storage), (Water, Storage), (Coal, Technology), (Distribution, Technology), (Electricity, Technology), (Exploration, Technology), (Gas, Technology), (Nuclear, Technology)}.
